messageSegments.text: Hi can anyone help with this issue?.A customer with a HTC One M8  is having trouble with The Simplicity Go app. When he tries to sign in it says his password is invalid. He has tried deleting the app, re-booting and then re-installing but this doesn't work. He has also tried changing the password. The app works fine on his Ipad and he is OK signing in on desktop. No live issues on iknow, but it suggests escalating on an e-form. Caroline

parent.name: RADAR - OSP's
parent.description:
RADAR OSP's - For External Contact Centre Advisors to report single user technology issues preventing them from providing simply great customer service and making Simplicity the Number 1 for customer service in the UK and ROI.

The RADAR Group is fully manned between the hours of 07:00 and 18:00 Mon - Fri and monitored 09:00 through 17:00 Sat - Sun and should be used for reporting issues directly to Technology for investigation and resolution. Issues affecting multiple agents or requiring immediate resolution should be dealt with via Team Managers and normal incident reporting processes.

Please provide us with as much information as possible (though do not post any customer detail).

preamble.text: RADAR - OSP's (Private) â Jonathan Hornby

parent.name: World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE)
parent.description:
The WWE has regular events on Simplicity Box Office and is another great reason to purchase Simplicity Sports.

Simplicity has progressively delivered more and more content for the WWE and now has a wealth of WWE programming throughout the week.

Rules
* Keep it clean
* Please be mindful if posting spoilers
* Keep it on-topic
* Posts regarding PPV events can only be discussed from Tuesday morning.
* Posts regarding RAW can only be discussed from Wednesday morning.

Topics To Avoid - They're all a bit over-done
* Favourite Wrestler
* Favourite Diva
* Favourite Move/Finisher
* Favourite Entrance 
* Favourite Music
* Favourite Promotion
* Favourite Era
* Favourite Match
* Favourite Faction
* Favourite Catchphrase

messageSegments.text:
Congratulations! Youâre at the top of your game.

I've just been listening to an On Demand call you took on 8th May and honestly couldn't have been more impressed! The customer was quite elderly and didn't really know what he was doing and you were extremely patient and communicated so clearly with him. You remained positive and encouraging throughout the call and did absolutely everything that you could to help the customer get their On Demand service up and running. You treated the customer exactly how any customer would want to be treated, and it was so fantastic to hear a call being managed in such a professional, and caring way! Well done!

messageSegments.text:
Alan's tip of the day/month as it's been a while!: 

When adding Simplicity Go for a customer ask if any children are going to use it. By default there is no PIN protection on any Simplicity Go content so that means anyone could playback anything on an iPad. No one wants a 12 year old watching SAW or Hostel.

PIN protection can be added Under mySimplicity,, Settings, Simplicity Go PIN or via the app but can only be amended or created by a Primary user.

messageSegments.text:
Hi Guys,

Just a bit of clarity in relation to Home Move Customers.

If a customer is looking to cancel due to the Home Move Fee and you save this customer by agreeing to waive this fee.  If the customer has phone and broadband you will need to transfer this customer to the National Home Move Centre.  A couple of things to be aware of:

- If the customer agrees to waive the home move fee then this re-contracts the customer for 12 months - YOU MUST inform the customer of this.  You will not be able to apply this offer or a credit to the account before the transfer as this will be picked up by the home move team.
- If you are agreeing to apply another Platform offer to the account then this must be applied before transferring the customer to the Home Move team.

As always we should be looking to have a value led conversation on the benefits of moving home before using offers.

Any questions please speak to your CEL or an SME.

body.text:
Hi Guys,

Just a bit of clarity in relation to Home Move Customers.

If a customer is looking to cancel due to the Home Move Fee and you save this customer by agreeing to waive this fee.  If the customer has phone and broadband you will need to transfer this customer to the National Home Move Centre.  A couple of things to be aware of:

- If the customer agrees to waive the home move fee then this re-contracts the customer for 12 months - YOU MUST inform the customer of this.  You will not be able to apply this offer or a credit to the account before the transfer as this will be picked up by the home move team.
- If you are agreeing to apply another Platform offer to the account then this must be applied before transferring the customer to the Home Move team.

As always we should be looking to have a value led conversation on the benefits of moving home before using offers.

Any questions please speak to your CEL or an SME.

@Clair Lynn@Elaine Fullerton@Paul Lynch@Sarah Mottram@Elaine Pawson

messageSegments.text:
Guys, just a gentle reminder about sending HYPERLINKS on chats...as per training, is as follows:

â¢	Sending URLâs:-
When sending URLSâ it is polite to follow the 3 steps. 

Step 1 â Get the ok from the customer for you to send a link. 
Step 2 â Send the link. 
Step 3 â Ask the customer how they are getting on with this link that you have sent. 

I know that some of us have thought that this a nice to have but from a Quality aspect this is a must.  Remember that we want to be number one in the country for our Customer Service - so it makes sense to only send links that are relevant and that the customer has said they are happy to receive.
You guys are doing an amazing job...keep it going!

messageSegments.text:
Can anyone clear this up for me. I have a customer who tried to take advantage of the wireless booster offer in January. As the customer had an older router, it wasn't compatible with the booster. So the customer took the offer for a free Hub instead.
The offer did state that if the Hub didn't resolve blackspot issues, to come back and get a wireless booster.
When the custoemr received her Hub, found it still didn't resolve blackspot issue, she went to order the booster, and was told it was out of stock, and that she would receive an email advising of when they came back in to stock to claim her free one.
Customer has never received this email, and is now being asked to pay for a wireless booster. Any suggestions?

messageSegments.text:
Thanks Mandeep When you have problems like this if you can use 'Close My App' to exit Chordiant and log back in. It is the quickest way for you to get back to your customer a good tip is to open 'Close My App' when you first login at the start of you shift  that way it will always be available in your task bar if you need it.

You should now see a RADAR flag button within the 'Chatter' tab on the menu bar. This means that you will no longer see other people's RADAR records within the news feed once everyone has moved over to using this method. If you can check that you have this and begin to use this to raise your RADAR posts.
